did.abstract: An association of Congregational ministers has existed in Detroit since 1887. In 1908, that Association was known as the Congregational Association of Detroit. In 1964, it became known as the Detroit Metropolitan Association. The association exists today as the Detroit Metropolitan & Eastern Associations. This collection contains a single mortgage agreement between the Detroit Metropolitan Association and the Congregational Church Building Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: An association for Congregational ministers in and around Detroit, Michigan, has been in existence since 1887. In 1908, that Association was known as the Congregational Association of Detroit. In 1964, the association formally joined with the Michigan Conference of the United Church of Christ and became known as the Detroit Metropolitan Association. At some point, the association merged with the Eastern Association to become the Detroit Metropolitan & Eastern Associations, an organization which is still active today.
